userActivity.Value: This exercie assumes you have a Linux VM setup and running Fedora.

data.title: Envrionment Setup
data.description: Getting the environment ready for MDE for Linux on Fedora

userActivity.Value: Update packages using the yum package manager
Each Linux distrobution has a different package manager. For example, Ubuntu uses apt-get, while Fedora uses yum.

userActivity.Value: yum-utils is a package that provides a collection of utilities and commands to enhance the functionality of the yum package manager
Add the Microsoft repo to isntall MDE
You can view the different repos available at https://packages.microsoft.com/config/fedora/
Select your distro and version to see the repo information.

backgroundActivity.Value: The Fedora package repository will be added to the system. This will allow you to install MDE using yum.
The output below shows the RPM package being added to the system.

userActivity.Value: Check the respoiory list to see if the Microsoft repo has been added

data.title: Explore the MDATP application
data.description: Let's check the configuration of the MDE for Linux agent

userActivity.Value: The 'mdatp health' command will show the health of the MDE for Linux agent. This will show if the agent is healthy, if there are any health issues, if the agent is licensed, and configurations values.

backgroundActivity.Value:

In this case we can see a licensing error. We need to run the onboarding script to register the agent with the MDATP service.

userActivity.Value: Make sure you have the correct permissions and licenses. You will need to be a Global Administrator or Security Administrator to access this page.
Then Select Linux Server from the drop list of operating systems.

tasks.title: Optional - Copy the onboarding script to the Linux server

userActivity.Value: Optional - Copy the onboarding script to the Linux server
If you are running Windows with Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL) you can copy the onboarding script to the Linux server using the following command.
The above command is using a certificate to authenitcate to the Linux server. You can also use a username and password.
The file copied is stored in the home directory of the user you are authenticating as.
From the folder where you have copied the onboarding script.
Let's check the current org_id configuration of the MDE for Linux agent.

backgroundActivity.Value: ATTENTION: No license found. Contact your administrator for help.

userActivity.Value: From the folder where you have copied the onboarding script. Run the python onboading script.
